name: Slieve Russell Hotel Golf and Country Club

reviews.text: Stayed on groupon deal for 2 nights in Nov. As previous poster said, there was nothing exceptional about afternoon tea sandwiches, however scones, jam and cream were nice, sweet not great. Overall was fine, but I wouldnt have got without groupon voucher.
reviews.title: excellent staff, beautifu hotel, working on tired areas

reviews.text: our room was spacious and clean. I did provide feedback that the travelcot we got was badly worn and our pillows were heavy, hard and uncomfortable. A member of staff did call me to apologise and plan to upgrade the pillows. Our bed was two singles joined together. I hate how even the best 5 star hotels I've been to do this and would put me off.
reviews.title: Disappointing afternoon tea

reviews.text: breakfast and dining room was great. The whole pool and spa area was excellent and we thoroughly enjoyed the garden walks and meticulous grounds.
reviews.title: Amazing should be more than 4 star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: enjoyed most elements. Staff all great, but wont plan to return again too soon.
reviews.title: Beautiful surroundings and walks. A haven for tranquility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After having a fabulous afternoon tea here earlier in the year i had no hesitation to bring a friend for a treat. However it was a very different experience. Firstly we were asked were we on a 'Groupon deal' which we werent but surely they dont need to ask this first thing- does it really matter or is service different??We asked for no butter on sandwiches which was fine. The tea arrived extremely quickly which we were surprised about but we could see why. The sandwiches were so poor and bland- a slice of beef no relish etc in between 2 slice of bread and same with slice of ham, and a slice of turkey- the egg mayo was nice though! Next tier- the scones were awful- one was so hard we could hardly cut it so i went looking for a staff member- i walked round the kells bar, the whole lobby area, the reception the setanta restaurant and no one was around so i ended up in the gift shop where the girl said she would sort it for me. A new scone arrived that was so hot u couldnt touch it and then went soggy because of the heating in a microwave. The mini desserts were not nice the cheesecake had a soggy bottom. It was fairly obvious all the tiers are done and ready to go and just dished out. We spoke to a lovely waitress (who hadnt served us because our waiter never came back) who was very nice and didn't charge us. I am generally a big fan of this hotel and got married here too but was feeling very disappointed and im Not sure if i would return for the afternoon tea.
reviews.title: Relaxing and Enjoyable Stay

reviews.text: Enjoyed one night here in a large family room with my wife and two children, this was for a family gathering. The hotel was very busy throughout the weekend and is popular with weddings and functions. The reception staff were friendly and efficient on arrival although on leaving there was some bill confusion and the wrong invoice presented twice. The function I attended had a hot buffet and its own room both were excellent and the service organised and fast. The service at the bar was very quick given how busy the hotel was. The health club pool was enjoyed by the four of us on the afternoon before our do, we timed it just right and it wasn't too crowded although others found it too busy. The breakfast choice was excellent and the quality good. The hotel grounds are lovely for a walk, the hotel itself is well maintained with plenty of areas to meet and enjoy a chat and a drink. Despite being so busy the functions were very well contained in terms of noise no disturbance to the bedrooms and very little guest noise in the corridors. I would go again for longer.
reviews.title: One night for a family gathering
Great place
reviews.text: Beautiful property, well maintained grounds and golf course. However, there are two complaints I had;

1) the hotel staff was unable to control the rowdy drunken wedding guests, even with many complaints at 1, 2, and 3 am followed by myself walking to the front desk to tell them they needed to keep it down.
reviews.title: Beautiful Getaway
Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: 2) no air conditioning, being from the states, it's a much needed convenience that I just can't go without when it's 85 +Fahrenheit out.
All in all it was a great stay, just two complaints.
reviews.title: Annoying

reviews.text: Stayed here for a long weekend. Fantastic hotel, excellent staff and delicious food. They offer great deals on groupon keep an eye out. Lovely grounds to walk around and a great spa. There was a live band playing in the bar one night and the place was buzzing. Great atmosphere.
reviews.title: Great value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on a Groupon deal for two nights last week. I cannot fault
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the Slieve Russell last week for two nights on a Groupon deal. The hotel is amazing. The grounds are beautiful. Our room was a standard room but it was big and airy and exceptionally clean. The bathroom had a bath and a very big shower. Made us wonder what the superior rooms would be like! All the staff were lovely. Food was superb. We had a wonderful afternoon tea. Loved the ambiance of the hotel. Even with a wedding on, the place was not crowded. Very relaxing. Can't wait to return. We would Highly Recommend this hotel for families and couples.
reviews.title: A must visit

reviews.text: Got a Groupon deal on e.mail. Went for 2 nights in September 2013. One night included dinner.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a 1st class hotel with wonderful staff and excellent rooms. The food is superb and the breakfast is like having dinner as there is so much of a variety to eat. We had dinner in the less formal restaurant and it was just lovely and plenty of it. No delay after we ordered and we then had a drink at the bar where the staff were great. A very friendly place to stay and could find no fault at all. We will definately return for another visit.
reviews.title: Stayed in the Superior Room

reviews.text: Me and my family stayed here on groupon deals. Four adults and 3 children. This is our 3rd time staying and once again very impressed. The hotel was very busy weddings both fri and sat but this didnt take away from the outstanding food we were served both nights. We also had afternoon tea in the bar area. Great varity of sandwiches and was very nice. breakfast was also very impressive and nothing in this hotel is a bother to staff. On the sunday morning my husband asked for some pineapple, the dining area was very busy but this wasnt a problem for staff. Within minutes the staff member returned with some fresh pineapple. Its the small things like this that make all the difference.The pool area is very clean and ideal with children of all ages. the Kids did go to the kids club one day and also got free evening tea. ideal for familys. We also had th luxury of visiting the spa, the girls are so professional and excellant at there jobs.Our room was immaculate and plenty o room for the kids things, pram etc.We cant wait to return soon
reviews.title: Outstanding stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights and were very impressed. The hotel is spacious and immaculate, and the grounds are beautiful. Our room was very comfortable and immaculate too. The food is lovely - we had afternoon tea, evening meal and breakfast and the quality was consistently very good. What most impressed us was the very high standard of customer service, which came across as genuine and not rehearsed or forced. We will definitely be back.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to this lovely hotel for 2 nights and stayed in a suite, the room was fab, the bed, I think was the comfiest I have ever slept in!! The spa was amazing and the food was lovely as were the staff and grounds to walk around. Will definitely be back here!
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived last wednesday on a Groupon deal - from Reception to bar, dining, gym staff all wonderful. You were not made feel any different because you were on Groupon deal. With the deal you got free afternoon tea (worth €20.00) which we bought the following day it was so good. The food was excellent we ate in the Restaurant the first night food excellent and in the bar the following night very good.
reviews.title: Excellent relaxing stay

reviews.text: Wonderful selection at breakfast - this is one hotel that you will not leave feeling hungry.
reviews.title: break

description: The Slieve Russell Hotel Golf & Country Club is a top quality four-star hotel. Set in 300 acres, including 50 acres of lakes, the resort offers a unique experience in relaxation and leisure. Facilities include 222 stylish bedrooms, a world-class spa, excellent conference and banqueting facilities, along with a magnificent leisure centre. Enhancing the facilities is a superb 18-hole championship golf course, in a survey of Irish Parkland Courses, was ranked at number twelve.
